reviews.review_msg: Both she and Dr. Ayers are great but both are also tough markers, so you can't just squeak by in this class.  You have to do the readings and understand the theories.  Marks hard on the final but was fair on the paper. The paper is due really early in the course,so if your topic is from the latter half of the course you are at a disadvantage.
She is new to teaching but she is awesome. Very helpful and a fair marker, she helps you a lot if you go see her. She is super smart as well!

She's terrific because she has the right balance of empathy and honesty, which is exactly what a teacher should have so the marking is not too easy but not merciless either. I have learned a lot in her classes about my strengths and weaknesses. I wish there were more like her. I wish her all the best in the future.
You learn a lot from her but she is pretty tough when it comes to marking.

Great prof. Ive taken a bunch of classes with Kevin and Ive gotten an A in all of them. He lays out what he wants very clearly and his exams hold no surprises. If you cant manage to get a good mark in his class the issue is you. Im amazed that so many people complain. How do you complain when your prof makes everything clear and simple?
Good for lower division classes but not so much for upper division.  Marks tough for upper division essays and seems disinterested in teaching.

I don't know where they found this guy!!!  The Political Science department is slowly burying itself. His classes are so basic, so boring, so uncritical.  If you want an easy grade, take him. If you actually want your money's worth and an education, I suggest you find someone else.
She made me do 50 sit-ups.....

Not helpful when asked. Provides feedback very late so it is not useful to improve on work. Lectures are very dry despite the class subject material being very interesting to me. She is not proficient with technology or she is lazy so she has no notes prepared.  Disorganized and not engaged. Avoid her at all costs.

She's a pretty easy grader and as long as you make an effort to participate in discussion posts and work on your final essay, you'll do fine. The final was pretty easy as well, and she was very generous in giving out marks. While she does respond very slowly, her comments are valuable and informative.

POL-343 is the worst class i have taken during my undergrad. Linda provides little to no assistance, feedback was given so late that it was hard to improve on papers, i had to keep sending her emails to get a response. Whoa too much stress, not worth it at all!

She is the reason I will never do online classes again. She takes forever to mark and respond. I never received my paper back and basically had to beg for it back and then she stopped replying to my emails. My final grade was not justified and when I asked her to clarify? Again, never replied. She is an absolute joke - do NOT take her class!

Linda is a very helpful prof.  I took the online version of GPE (Poli 343) with her and she is the only thing that gave me motivation throughout the course because the readings are numerous and  aside from the O+W text all of the material was left-wing borderline communist propaganda. Linda did not write the course herself.  Avoid the course online

Response times were ridiculously slow. But her feedback was some of the best I have ever received from a prof, so I guess it balances out. She definitely goes the extra mile to help you when you have questions, and her grading was quite fair.

What a horrible class. I did it Distance Ed. Linda had no idea how to use WebCT and response times were slow. I asked her what the class average was for the midterm-she didnt have it. Asked her for a breakdown of marks at the end of term-twice- and havent heard back. Maybe she is better in class but definitely do not take distance ed with her.

Excellent prof. Classes were interesting and informative, and the the tutorials were engaging (students were more than ready to contribute). A lot of reading is assigned, but she tells you at the beginning of the semester that you don't need to do all of it. I didn't find this course to be as demanding as I had expected, though not easy either.

Both she and Liz the TA are great but both are also tough markers, so you can't just squeak by in this class.  You have to do the readings and understand the theories.  Marks hard on the final but was fair on the paper. The paper is due really early in the course,so if your topic is from the latter half of the course you are at a disadvantage.

Global Political Economy - Great Prof super engaging and clear! She is a fair marker. If her TA is Elizabeth Blackwood your set she is amazing too! Dr. Ayers plays a lot of documentaries which helps, and she lectures and sends her notes if ask her!

Definitely a fantastic teacher.  Her TA was a hard marker and the reading load was fairly heavy.  I have friends who took the course with Logan Masilamani and did way better in terms of grades but she is a better teacher in my opinion.

Great class, teacher, TA! One of the few courses in SFU which shows a different (critical) prospective of GPE. Teacher very knowledgeable, approachable, fun. Course very well structured. Fair grades! A course that should be taken by every serious political science student.

Great professor, great TA (Elizabeth Blackwood)interesting class. Movies at the end of the class were great for people like me who hate being lectured to for 3 hours straight (and I actually learned a lot from the movies). Definitely take this class with her!
great

Very nice, very helpful. Interesting class, there is no denying that it is quite radical, the readings did have weeks where there were fair presentations of both sides. However, it seemed like there was a lot of criticizing. Didn't look at prescription-to-situation ideas very often either.

This class was extremely helpful in making clear the economic system we are currently engaged in. I don't feel that her class was biased, as the syllabus was comprehensive and included thinkers of all perspectives. It also seems a little outdated to be criticizing this prof for having a political/social perspective. She should be praised!

I am almost done my degree and this class is the best I've taken. I have heard claims that she is biased but this is simply not true. I'm not 'left', but found this course fair and respective of diverse opinions. Yes it includes critical readings, but there are many that represent mainstream pol/econ and both texts are liberal in perspective.

Very nice prof. Im an economics student with a Political Science background and figured this class would be easy. Her readings are very biased with all the key readings based on a critical Marxist perspective. She explained what the liberal perspective was at the beginning of the course then simply criticized it the rest of the course. Not balanced
She is tough and so are her TAs.  If you want to mess up your GPA take the course with her.

Alison is a fantastic instructor.  She's one of few who actually care about her students; she will always be willing to meet with you, answer questions, and explain.  Class time is full of learning--which is a lot more than I can say about other teachers in the polisci department.  She's a real asset to political science and SFU.

She is a great professor. I felt encouraged when I had her class. She is willing to give a permit to student to do something that he/she wants if his/her work make Dr. Alison interest. I like this prof very much, and I'm the one who talk in her class all the time, and she is willing to tell what she know to her student.
she's a tough marker, but also a helpful professor - as long as you're there to learn, she's one of the best profs you'll ever get. if you're a slacker - (good luck!)
course was very interesting and Ted Cohen's text book was a god sent.  The prof is very interesting but she has no interest in actually helping her students and she is terrible with email.
Interesting material but grade was below my normal average.  Mid-term was easy but the TA marking the paper was a pain.

Reading load was very manageable.  However, i have to say that while she is very helpful in giving you tips for your research paper, she tended not to reflect the improvements you make in the grade given.  The final exam was tough.  You had to know small details and while the readings were fairly easy, the exam questions were much tougher.
I got B- but I have no complaints about it. She was totally fair in grading students' works. No need for too much works but fair amount of works

Sherri is an excellent prof, but you should only take her class if you are willing to be challenged and are willing to put in the work. It is not hard to get an A or a B in her class, but you need to follow her instructions and put in the time and effort. She is extremely helpful, responsive, clear, and informative. One of my favourite profs.
she is an enthusiastic prof. I was a little disappointed when she did not recognize the national flag of India. Other than that, she is decent.

This is definitely the worst Prof I have experienced in 3 years at SFU. He does not stick to his office hours.He also doesn't answer emails. I asked him repeatedly to provide feedback on my work to no avail. He should NOT be teaching!
Migone doesn't care about teaching. Doesn't answer emails or give students any of his time.  Would never take one of his classes again.

Prof. Andrea Migone is a horrible online instructor.  He spends no time interacting with students and his marks seem to be completely random  as he provides NO feedback or criticisms to help you improve.  I have met him and he seems passionate about politics, but he should be stopped from ever teaching online courses.

I had him a while ago.  Very tough on plagiarism, even if it was unintentional.  Lectures off of his power points and goes off on tangents.  Not too exciting, not totally hard but definitely no room for slacking off.

He's the worst prof at SFU.  He is very intelligent but doesn't seem to be able to relay that information to his students.  Focus on your paper and your MT and you can do well.  Just make sure to cite everything!

He's an interesting professor but if you actually want to learn about IPE, I suggest you take the course with another prof.  He lectures off powerpoint and doesn't really try to engage students at all. He turned an interesting course into a waste of time.  He is obviously a very capable academic but it would be nice if he cared about his students .

A capable professor, but his lecture style is very dull, and he is unable to graps and maintain students' attention. He is knowledgeable, but had difficulties explaining much of the course material to us.
